name: Gas Spore
lore: A gas spore is a fungal creature that bears an uncanny resemblance to a beholder. It drifts through dark caverns, and when destroyed, it bursts in a cloud of deadly spores that can infect and kill living creatures, spawning new gas spores from the remains.

traits.name: Death Burst
traits.description: When the gas spore is reduced to 0 Hit Points, it explodes in a cloud of spores. Each creature within 20 feet of it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or take 10 (3d6) Poison damage and have the Poisoned condition. A Poisoned creature takes 5 (1d10) Poison damage at the start of each of its turns. The creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. A creature reduced to 0 Hit Points by this damage dies, and 1d4 Tiny gas spores sprout from the dead creature's corpse 2d4 hours later.

traits.name: Eerie Resemblance
traits.description: The gas spore resembles a Beholder. A creature that can see the gas spore can discern its true nature with a successful DC 15 Intelligence (Nature) check.

actions.name: Touch
actions.description: Melee Attack Roll: +0, reach 5 ft. Hit: 1 Poison damage.
